\begin{thm}\label{thm3} For a finite semigroup $A$, $P_{\theta ^{(n)}}(A)=1$ for some non-negative integer $n$ if and only if $A$ is an ideal extension of a left zero semigroup by a nilpotent semigroup.

Then, by Theorem 5 of \cite{Nagyleft:sg-6}, $\iota ^{(n)}_A=\omega _A$ for some non-negative integer $n$. If $n\geq 1$ then $\omega _A=\iota ^{(n)}_A=\theta ^{(n-1)}$ and so, by Theorem 5 of \cite{Nagyleft:sg-6}, $P_{\theta ^{(n-1)}}(A)=1$.
